name: Poly Resonator
description: It's lots of Rings! This algorithm is a polysynth where each voice is essentially a Rings (the open source Rings module by Émilie Gillet). Rings itself does support a kind of polyphony, but it’s limited by having a single pitch and gate input – it’s very much designed so that only one note is triggered at a time. This algorithm gives you a full Rings implementation for each voice, with the convenience of shared parameter control.

specifications.name: Resolution
specifications.description: The number of resonator building blocks that contribute to the overall sound. Defaults to 16 (equivalent to a Rings set to 4-voice polyphony). Higher values increase CPU load.

input_ports.name: Audio input
input_ports.description: Selects which input bus to use for the audio input, allowing routing from different sources.

input_ports.name: CV/gate input (per voice)
input_ports.description: Uses standard polysynth CV/gate parameters for pitch and gate control per voice. See 'Common polysynth features' above.

output_ports.name: Odd output
output_ports.description: The bus used for the Odd output signal, which can be added or replaced in the mix.

output_ports.name: Even output
output_ports.description: The bus used for the Even output signal, which can be added or replaced in the mix.
